template.name: Template Module Generic SNMPv3
template.description: Template Module Generic version: 0.14 MIBs used: SNMPv2-MIB

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: Item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

item.name: Device contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Device location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Fred Router'.

item.name: Device uptime
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has been restarted
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. The device uptime is less than 10 minutes

trigger.name: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: {Template Module ICMP Ping:icmppingloss.min(5m)}>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and {Template Module ICMP Ping:icmppingloss.min(5m)}<100

discovery_rule.name: Network Interfaces Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovering interfaces from IF-MIB. Interfaces with down(2) Administrative Status are not discovered.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Inbound pkts discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Inbound non-unicast pkts
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of non-unicast (i.e., subnetwork- broadcast or subnetwork-multicast) packets delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Inbound unicast pkts
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of subnetwork-unicast packets delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Inbound pkts with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface,including framing characters. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occurat re-initialization of the management system, and atother times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Outbound pkts discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Outbound pkts with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Outbound non-unicast pkts
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted to a non- unicast (i.e., a subnetwork-broadcast or subnetwork-multicast) address, including those that were discarded or not sent.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occurat re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Outbound unicast pkts
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted to a subnetwork-unicast address, including those that were discarded or not sent.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in bits per second. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. If the bandwidth of the interface is greater than the maximum value reportable by this object then this object should report its maximum value (4,294,967,295) and ifHighSpeed must be used to report the interace's speed. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned NumbersAuthority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: MAC Address
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The interface's address at the protocol layer immediately `below' the network layer in the protocol stack. For interfaces which do not have such an address (e.g., a serial line), this object should contain an octet string of zero length.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].change()}<0 and {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0 and ( {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=6 or {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=7 or {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=11 or {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=62 or {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=69 or {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=117 ) and ({Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].change()}>0 and {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].prev()}>0) or ({Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.in[ifInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF_UTIL_MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} or {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.out[ifOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF_UTIL_MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}) and {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.in[ifInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF_UTIL_MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} and {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.out[ifOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF_UTIL_MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: High bandwidth usage >{$IF_UTIL_MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}%

dependency.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(5m)}>{$IF_ERRORS_WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(5m)}>{$IF_ERRORS_WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(5m)}<{$IF_ERRORS_WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}-2 and {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(5m)}<{$IF_ERRORS_WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}-2
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: High error rate

dependency.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Module Interfaces Simple SNMPv3:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

template.name: Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv3
template.description: Template Net Mikrotik MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB MIKROTIK-MIB

item.name: Device: Temperature
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB (mtxrHlTemperature) Device temperature in Celsius (degrees C). Might be missing in entry models (RB750, RB450G..) Reference: http://wiki.mikrotik.com/wiki/Manual:SNMP

trigger.name: Device: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"Device"}
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger.name: Device: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"Device"}
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: Device: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"Device"}

trigger.name: Firmware has changed
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Firmware version has changed. Ack to close

trigger.name: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

item.name: Total memory
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

item.name: Used memory
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle.Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary.

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery CPU
discovery_rule.description: MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrHlProcessorTemperature Since temperature of CPU is not available on all Mikrotik hardware, this is done to avoid unsupported items.

item_prototype.name: CPU: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB (mtxrHlProcessorTemperature) Processor temperature in Celsius (degrees C). Might be missing in entry models (RB750, RB450G..)

trigger_prototype.name: CPU: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"CPU"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: CPU: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"CPU"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: CPU: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"CPU"}

trigger_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low

dependency.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low

item_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Total space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

item_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Used space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.
